name: Pearlspear Courier
text:
You may choose not to untap Pearlspear Courier during your untap step.
{2}{W}, {T}: Target Soldier creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance for as long as Pearlspear Courier remains tapped.

name: Peat Bog
text:
Peat Bog enters the battlefield tapped with two depletion counters on it.
{T}, Remove a depletion counter from Peat Bog: Add {B}{B} to your mana pool. If there are no depletion counters on Peat Bog, sacrifice it.

name: Pedantic Learning
text: Whenever a land card is put into your graveyard from your library, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Even the trivial can inspire.

name: Peek
text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Sometimes you have to read between the minds.
Sometimes you have to read between the minds.

name: Peel from Reality
text: Return target creature you control and target creature you don't control to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: "Soulless demon, you are bound to me. Now we will both dwell in oblivion."
When House Dimir's secrets are in danger of exposure, the guild takes drastic measures to cover its tracks.

editions.flavor: "The Great Conduit connects us all."

text:
Trample
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

editions.flavor: Connected as artificer and invention, bonded as rider and steed.

name: Peer Pressure
text: Choose a creature type. If you control more creatures of that type than each other player, you gain control of all creatures of that type. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Peer Through Depths
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an instant or sorcery card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

—Vec lore

Trample

Enchant creature

name: Penance
text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: The next time a black or red source of your choice would deal damage this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Pendelhaven
text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"
"This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

—Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,

name: Pendelhaven Elder
text: {T}: Each 1/1 creature you control gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The elder who carries the ancestral mantle of Jacques le Vert is tasked with his ancient mission: to protect the creatures of Pendelhaven.

name: Pendrell Drake
text:
Flying
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The mages of Tolaria found strange ways to spend their free time. Occasionally they had contests to see whose kite was eaten last.

name: Pendrell Flux
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay its mana cost."

editions.flavor: Devoured by the mists, Tolaria was stuck in time, trapped between two eternal heartbeats.

name: Pendrell Mists
text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay {1}."

editions.flavor: As insubstantial—and as insistent—as appetite.

name: Pendulum of Patterns
text:
When Pendulum of Patterns enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Pendulum of Patterns: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Its elaborate designs reveal secrets of aether's flow.

name: Pennon Blade
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
Equip {4}

editions.flavor: Draped with the pennon of a fallen outpost, the sword came to symbolize the peoples of Zendikar becoming one.

The Champion and her companions marched through the night, but the battle was over before they arrived. In the middle of the carnage sat a solitary minotaur, lost in what seemed to the Champion to be thought.
—The Theriad

name: Pentad Prism
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a charge counter from Pentad Prism: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Pentagram of the Ages
text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

editions.flavor: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.

—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

text: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.

editions.flavor: "Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies." —Vervamon the Elder

name: Peppersmoke
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If you control a Faerie, draw a card.

editions.flavor: Like being trapped in a perpetual sneeze, faerie-dust poisoning is both exhilarating and agonizing.
Like being trapped in a perpetual sneeze, faerie-dust poisoning is both exhilarating and agonizing.

text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Shuffle your library, then scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

text:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.

That the Tolarian mists parted for the drakes was warning enough to stay away.

—Talrand, sky summoner

text:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor: A griffin is not just an eagle's wings and a lion's claws. It is also the fiercest of hearts.

text:
Equipped creature has defender, flying, and first strike.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: The mask confers both the prowess of a falcon and its loyalty.

name: Perfected Form
text: Flying

editions.flavor: The final pages of the experiment log were blank. Investigators found it abandoned on a desk in the researcher's lab, open, the pages flipping in the wind from a shattered window.

name: Perilous Forays
text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for a land card with a basic land type and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"This is the place? This map has got to be wrong . . . ."
—Svania Trul, wayfinder novice, last words

name: Perilous Myr
text: When Perilous Myr dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: To Mirrodin, an explosive. To Phyrexia, a missionary.

name: Perilous Predicament
text: Each opponent sacrifices an artifact creature and a nonartifact creature.

editions.flavor: Comrades in life. Comrades in death.

name: Perilous Research
text: Draw two cards, then sacrifice a permanent.

editions.flavor: When the School of the Unseen fell, so many magical treasures lay abandoned that no amount of death could deter the stream of thieves and desperate scholars.

name: Perilous Shadow
text: {1}{B}: Perilous Shadow gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: There are some shadows that even the Dimir fear.

name: Perilous Vault
text: {5}, {T}, Exile Perilous Vault: Exile all nonland permanents.

editions.flavor: The spirit dragon Ugin arranged the hedrons of Zendikar to direct leylines of energy. To disrupt one is to unleash devastation and chaos.

name: Perimeter Captain
text:
Defender
Whenever a creature you control with defender blocks, you may gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: "We stand between the jaws of chaos and the mantle of order."

name: Perish
text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.

"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec

"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Perish the Thought
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player shuffles that card into his or her library.

editions.flavor: It removed only one idea from her mind: defiance.

name: Permafrost Trap
text:
If an opponent had a green creature enter the battlefield under his or her control this turn, you may pay {U} rather than pay Permafrost Trap's mana cost.
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

name: Permeating Mass
text: Whenever Permeating Mass deals combat damage to a creature, that creature becomes a copy of Permeating Mass.

editions.flavor: Woodland geists concluded that Emrakul would be unable to warp the denizens of the forest if the geists got there first.

name: Pernicious Deed
text: {X}, Sacrifice Pernicious Deed: Destroy each artifact, creature, and enchantment with converted mana cost X or less.

editions.flavor:
"The tyrannous and bloody deed is done, The most arch deed of piteous massacre That ever yet this land was guilty of."
—William Shakespeare, Richard III
"Yawgmoth," Freyalise whispered as she set the bomb, "now you will pay for your treachery."
"Yawgmoth," Freyalise whispered as she set the bomb, "now you will pay for your treachery."

name: Perpetual Timepiece
text:
{T}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{2}, Exile Perpetual Timepiece: Shuffle any number of target cards from your graveyard into your library.

editions.flavor: Do not be so caught up in keeping track of time that you forget to make use of it.

name: Perplex
text:
Counter target spell unless its controller discards his or her hand.
Transmute {1}{U}{B} ({1}{U}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as this card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library. Transmute only as a sorcery.)

name: Perplexing Chimera
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may exchange control of Perplexing Chimera and that spell. If you do, you may choose new targets for the spell. (If the spell becomes a permanent, you control that permanent.)

name: Persecute
text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

editions.flavor:
"My finest warrior was lost to the Phyrexians. I pray that Lady Selenia died honorably."
—Radiant, archangel

"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind
The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden,
"The Hind and the Panther"
"I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind

editions.flavor: The torches and pitchforks were no match for Rebecca's fans.

editions.flavor:
"There is a place deep within my soul where no foe can intrude and no tyrant can conquer."

"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"
